description: Daily Quests: Library of 20+ quest templates that adapt to user level, location, time, and behavioral patterns

daily_quests.description: Go completely offline for 1 hour. Phone stays on (for emergencies), but you don't touch it. No checking. No peeking. Just exist.
daily_quests.success_condition: 1 hour without touching phone, verified by screen time data
instructions: Choose your hour (ideally when you usually scroll)
Tell someone you're offline if needed
Put phone face-down, sound on
Do anything else: read, walk, cook, stare at walls
After 1 hour, check back in
daily_quests.failure_grace: If you slip, restart the timer. You get 2 attempts per day.
daily_quests.research_note: Digital fasts reduce anxiety and improve attention span (Wilcockson et al., 2019)

daily_quests.description: Go outside. Find grass, dirt, or nature. Stay for 15 minutes. Phone in pocket or bag. GPS will verify.
daily_quests.success_condition: 15+ minutes outdoors, GPS verified + low screen time during window
instructions: Leave your space (home, office, wherever)
Find green space, park, or outdoor area
Stand, sit, or walk for 15 minutes
Phone can stay in pocket—just don't use it
Breathe. Look around. Be here.
daily_quests.failure_grace: Checked your phone? That's okay. Put it away and finish the 15 minutes.
daily_quests.research_note: Nature exposure for 15+ min reduces cortisol (Hunter et al., 2019)

daily_quests.description: Call someone. Not text. Voice or video. Talk for at least 10 minutes. Hear a human voice.
daily_quests.success_condition: 10+ minute call logged in phone app
instructions: Pick someone you haven't spoken to in a while
Call them (voice or video—your choice)
Talk for at least 10 minutes
No multitasking during the call
Be present. Listen. Connect.
daily_quests.failure_grace: Went to voicemail? Try someone else. The quest is about connection, not perfection.
daily_quests.research_note: Voice calls increase bonding more than text (Kumar & Epley, 2021)

daily_quests.description: Don't touch your phone for 1 hour after waking. Sound on. No airplane mode. Just don't pick it up.
daily_quests.success_condition: First phone touch 60+ minutes after waking
instructions: Set this intention before sleep
When you wake, note the time mentally
Do your morning routine without your phone
After 1 hour, you're free to check in
Notice how your morning feels different
daily_quests.failure_grace: Autopilot grabbed it? Forgive yourself. Put it down. Try to finish the hour.
daily_quests.research_note: Morning phone use sets reactivity patterns for the day (Kushlev & Dunn, 2019)

daily_quests.description: No screens for 1 hour before bed. Read, journal, stretch, talk. Let your brain wind down naturally.
daily_quests.success_condition: 60 minutes of zero screen time before sleep
instructions: 1 hour before your target bedtime, put all screens away
Read a physical book, journal, do gentle stretching
Dim the lights if you can
Let your body naturally prepare for sleep
Notice if you sleep better
daily_quests.failure_grace: Checked 'one last thing'? Close it. You still have time to finish the hour.
daily_quests.research_note: Pre-sleep screen use delays circadian rhythm (Chang et al., 2015)

daily_quests.description: Make something with your hands for 30 minutes. Cook, draw, build, write. Create, don't consume.
daily_quests.success_condition: 30 minutes logged on timer, self-reported creation type
instructions: Choose your medium: cooking, drawing, writing, crafting, building
Set a 30-minute timer
Create without scrolling for inspiration
It doesn't have to be good—just made by you
Document what you made (optional)
daily_quests.failure_grace: Looked something up? That's okay. Close it and keep creating.
daily_quests.research_note: Creative activities increase dopamine and reduce stress (Stuckey & Nobel, 2010)

daily_quests.description: Walk outside during sunrise or sunset for 15 minutes. Watch the sky. Feel the shift.
daily_quests.success_condition: 15 minutes outdoors during golden hour, GPS verified
instructions: Check sunrise/sunset time for your location
Go outside 10 minutes before
Walk or stand and watch the transition
Phone can be with you—just keep it pocketed
Notice the colors, the temperature, the quality of light
daily_quests.failure_grace: Missed the golden hour? Walk during regular daylight. Still counts, reduced XP.
daily_quests.research_note: Natural light exposure regulates circadian rhythm (Wright et al., 2013)

daily_quests.description: Do one anonymous act of kindness today. Pay for someone's coffee, leave a nice note, help a stranger.
daily_quests.success_condition: Self-reported action + brief description
instructions: Think of one small act of kindness
Do it anonymously if possible
Examples: compliment, pay-it-forward, help someone carry something
Don't post about it. Just do it.
Notice how it feels after
daily_quests.failure_grace: Couldn't find an opportunity? That's okay. Try tomorrow. The intention matters.
daily_quests.research_note: Acts of kindness increase happiness and reduce stress (Curry et al., 2018)

daily_quests.description: Commute without touching your phone. Drive, walk, or ride—but don't scroll. Music via smartwatch/car is fine.
daily_quests.success_condition: Zero screen time during commute window, GPS verified
instructions: Before leaving, queue up music/podcast if needed
Put phone in bag, pocket, or center console
Drive, walk, or ride without checking
Notice your surroundings instead
Arrive without digital baggage
daily_quests.failure_grace: Checked for directions? That's utility, not scrolling. Continue.
daily_quests.research_note: Mindful commuting reduces stress and improves arrival mood (Legrain et al., 2015)

daily_quests.description: Eat one full meal with your phone in another room. Taste your food. Chew slowly. Be here.
daily_quests.success_condition: Meal duration 15+ minutes, zero screen time during meal
instructions: Before sitting down, put phone in another room
Sit at a table (not couch, not bed)
Eat slowly. Chew each bite 15-20 times.
Notice taste, texture, temperature
Finish when you're full, not when content ends
daily_quests.failure_grace: Habit pulled you to check? Forgive yourself. Finish the meal phone-free.
daily_quests.research_note: Mindful eating improves digestion and reduces overeating (Wansink, 2006)

daily_quests.description: Write 200 words by hand. Journal entry, letter, story—anything. Feel the pen move.
daily_quests.success_condition: Timer proof (15 min) + self-reported completion
instructions: Grab paper and pen (not laptop, not phone notes)
Set 15-minute timer
Write continuously. No editing. No deleting.
200 words is about one page
Let the words flow without judgment
daily_quests.failure_grace: Didn't hit 200? That's fine. The act of writing matters more than the count.
daily_quests.research_note: Handwriting activates different brain areas than typing (Mueller & Oppenheimer, 2014)

daily_quests.description: Take a 2-minute cold shower. Start warm, end cold. Breathe through it. Feel alive.
daily_quests.success_condition: Self-reported completion + timer verification
instructions: Start your shower at normal temperature
After washing, gradually turn temp to cold
Stay under cold water for 2 full minutes
Breathe slowly and deeply
Exit when timer ends. Feel the rush.
daily_quests.failure_grace: Only made it 1 minute? Still counts for 50% XP. Cold is hard.
daily_quests.research_note: Cold exposure increases dopamine and norepinephrine (Shevchuk, 2008)

daily_quests.description: No social media apps for 6 hours. Instagram, TikTok, Twitter, all of it—closed. You can still text.
daily_quests.success_condition: Zero minutes on social apps for 6-hour window
instructions: Choose your 6-hour window (during waking hours)
Set app limits or delete apps temporarily if needed
You can still call, text, use maps, music
Notice the urge to check. Let it pass.
After 6 hours, reflect on how you feel
daily_quests.failure_grace: Slipped once? Close the app and finish the 6 hours. One slip = warning, not failure.
daily_quests.research_note: Social media breaks reduce FOMO and improve well-being (Tromholt, 2016)

daily_quests.description: Visit a museum, gallery, or library. Spend 45+ minutes. Phone on airplane mode. Just observe.
daily_quests.success_condition: GPS verification at cultural location + 45 min duration
instructions: Find a nearby museum, gallery, or library
Put phone on airplane mode (photos okay)
Wander slowly. Read plaques. Sit with art.
No Instagram documentation—just experience
Leave when you're ready, minimum 45 minutes
daily_quests.failure_grace: Turned off airplane mode to check something? Put it back. Keep wandering.
daily_quests.research_note: Museum visits increase creativity and reduce rumination (Clow & Fredhoi, 2006)

daily_quests.description: Eat lunch away from your desk/usual spot. Go outside or to another room. Phone stays behind.
daily_quests.success_condition: GPS shows location change + 20 min duration + low screen time
instructions: When lunch time comes, pack up your food
Leave phone at your desk/in your bag
Go outside, to a break room, or different space
Eat slowly. Look around. Rest.
Return to work after 20+ minutes
daily_quests.failure_grace: Brought your phone? Put it face down. Don't use it. Quest still counts.
daily_quests.research_note: Lunch breaks away from workspace improve afternoon productivity (Kim et al., 2017)

daily_quests.description: Listen to brown/white noise or binaural beats for 20 minutes. Lie down. Let your brain rest.
daily_quests.success_condition: 20 min audio playback + minimal movement (motion sensors)
instructions: Find brown noise, white noise, or binaural beats (YouTube, Spotify, app)
Lie down in a comfortable position
Headphones on. Press play. Close your eyes.
Let the sound wash over you for 20 minutes
Notice how your nervous system settles
daily_quests.failure_grace: Fell asleep? Perfect. That's what your body needed. Quest complete.
daily_quests.research_note: Brown noise masks distractions and promotes parasympathetic activation (Soderlund et al., 2007)

daily_quests.description: Have a 20-minute face-to-face conversation with someone. No phones visible. Just talk.
daily_quests.success_condition: Self-reported + 20 min timer verification + screen time check
instructions: Ask someone to have a conversation (friend, family, partner, roommate)
Both put phones away (not on table—away)
Talk for at least 20 minutes
No checking, no 'one sec' moments
Ask questions. Listen. Connect.
daily_quests.failure_grace: Someone's phone went off? That's okay. Ignore it. Keep talking.
daily_quests.research_note: Phone-free conversations increase empathy and connection (Misra et al., 2016)

daily_quests.description: Visit a bookstore. Browse for 30+ minutes. Read first pages. Buy one or leave empty-handed.
daily_quests.success_condition: GPS at bookstore + 30 min duration + low screen time
instructions: Find a local bookstore (not Amazon, not your phone)
Walk in with no specific title in mind
Browse aisles. Pick up books. Read back covers.
Read first pages of 3-5 books
Buy one if it calls to you, or leave with inspiration
daily_quests.failure_grace: Looked up a review on your phone? Close it. Trust your gut instead.
daily_quests.research_note: Analog browsing reduces decision fatigue and increases serendipity (Thudt et al., 2012)

daily_quests.description: Explore somewhere new for 2+ hours. Phone on silent in bag. Get lost. Find your way.
daily_quests.success_condition: GPS shows new location + 2 hour duration + minimal screen time
instructions: Pick a neighborhood, trail, or part of town you've never explored
Bring phone for safety but keep it in bag on silent
Wander for 2+ hours. Get lost on purpose.
Use maps if truly lost, but try to navigate by intuition
Notice details: architecture, sounds, people, smells
daily_quests.failure_grace: Checked your phone a few times? That's okay. Put it away and keep exploring.
daily_quests.research_note: Novel experiences increase dopamine and improve memory encoding (Wittmann et al., 2007)

daily_quests.description: No screens after 6 PM until 6 AM next morning. 12 hours. The ultimate reclamation.
daily_quests.success_condition: Zero screen time from 6 PM to 6 AM next day
instructions: At 6 PM, put all screens away (phone, laptop, tablet, TV)
Cook, read, talk, create, rest—anything analog
Sleep without phone as alarm (use analog clock)
Wake naturally. Wait until 6 AM to check anything.
Notice how your evening and morning feel different
daily_quests.failure_grace: This is mastery-level. If you slip, restart tomorrow. No partial credit.
daily_quests.research_note: Extended digital fasts reset dopamine baselines and improve sleep architecture (Lembke, 2021)
